metadata.title: CVE-2016-6128 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The gdImageCropThreshold function in gd_crop.c in the GD Graphics Library(aka libgd) before 2.2.3, as used in PHP before 7.0.9, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via an invalidcolor index.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.2
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.2').
